title: Why was Joseph Stalin so good at escaping prisons? - Quora

response.answer_text: It wasn’t that Koba (Stalin) was good at getting out of Imperial Russian prisons, it was that Imperial Russian prisons were lousy at keeping people in. Not to worry though. When the Communists came to power under Lenin and then Stalin they changed all of that by making Russian Imperial prisons into the deadly Gulag which, in 1941, killed more Soviet prisoners in a single week than the Imperial Russian system did in its last 30 years of existance.

The rumours were reinforced by being published in the Soviet Union memoirs of Domenty Vadachkory, who wrote that Stalin used an Okhranka badge (supposedly stolen) to help himescape exile. It also appears suspicious that Stalin played down the number of his escapes from prisonsand exiles
